title: Merge k Sorted Lists
description:
You are given an array of `k` linked-lists `lists`, each linked-list is sorted in ascending order.

Merge all the linked-lists into one sorted linked-list and return it.

examples.explanation: The linked-lists are: [1->4->5, 1->3->4, 2->6]. Merging them into one sorted list: 1->1->2->3->4->4->5->6

constraints: lists[i] is sorted in ascending order.
The sum of lists[i].length will not exceed 10^4.
hints: Consider using a min-heap (priority queue) to always get the smallest element across all lists.
Another approach is divide and conquer: merge pairs of lists, then merge those results.
You can reuse the 'merge two sorted lists' solution as a building block.
